intro: Anil argentea, commonly known as silver anil, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, silver-white leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
